title: Business Live: Tech shares down again - BBC News
summary: tech shares drag wall street down on open .
shire shares soar on possible takeover .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for today on business live - thanks for reading .
we 'll be back bright and early at 06:00 on thursday .
do join us then for all the latest breaking news and analysis from the business world .

documents.title: mixed for wall street
text: it was a mixed for wall street at the close , despite gains in healthcare and retail stocks having tempered sharp falls in technology shares .
the dow jones industrial average ended flat at 23,848.42 .
the s & p 500 slipped 0.3 % to 2,605 .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq dropped 0.9 % to 6,949.23 .

documents.title: nokia in row with intelsat and ses over 5g
text: nokia is embroiled in a an argument with satellite operators ses and intelsat over opening up mobile spectrum between 3.7ghz and 4.2ghz .
the telecommunications technology provider says that the us federal communications commission ( fcc ) should allocate much more bandwidth for 5g mobile internet , according to mobile world live .

intelsat and chipset manufacturer intel had proposed in october 2017 that 100mhz of spectrum should be freed up for 5g , but nokia wants to see between 80-100mhz of spectrum allocated to each mobile operator in the country .

documents.title: amazon shares fall on trump report
text: you might have seen that amazon is n't having a good day today .
it seems the reason amazon 's shares fell today is because news website axios reported that us president donald trump is keen to rein in the internet giant 's growing power .
axios says its sources say trump wants to change amazon 's tax policies in order to protect brick-and-mortar businesses from being put out of business .
he 's wondered aloud if there may be any way to go after amazon with antitrust or competition law , '' the source said .
amazon 's shares are now down 5 % to $ 1,422.28 .

documents.title: royal mail workers back pensions deal
text: royal mail postal workers have voted to back a deal on pay , working conditions and pensions that would prevent strikes .

the communication workers union says its members have overwhelmingly '' backed a settlement that includes a pay rise and shorter working hours , as well as a new retirement fund , by a margin of 9 to 1 , according to ft .
workers were unhappy after royal mail decided to close its `` defined benefit '' retirement fund that covers 90,000 members , saying it was no longer affordable .

documents.title: replenishing the uk 's stock of rental homes
text: institutional investors are building thousands of new rental properties .
will this improve the uk 's stock of rental homes ?

documents.title: twitter bans tommy robinson
text: tommy robinson - ex-leader of the english defence league - has been banned from twitter .
his account is marked as being `` suspended '' , but the bbc has learned that the us company has decided to permanently revoke his access .
twitter declined to comment , but it is understood the decision was taken after mr robinson was judged to have breached its `` hateful conduct '' policy .

documents.title: lawsuit over trump foreign payments to go ahead
text: a us federal judge has refused to throw out a lawsuit that accuses president donald trump of flouting constitutional safeguards against corruption by maintaining ownership of his business empire while in office .
the department of justice had asked the court to throw the case out completely .
us district judge peter messitte decided that part of the case should be allowed to proceed - the claims that relate only to the trump international hotel in washington .

documents.title: reckitt benckiser chief executive 's pay slashed
text: reckitt benckiser 's chief executive rakesh kapoor has had his pay slashed by £ 11m .
mr kapoor is entitled to an annual pay of £ 23.7m , but he has volunteered to give some of it back to the firm , which owns well known household brands like dettol and durex .
reckitt benckiser decided to ask for half of his long-term incentive pay , which was meant to reward performance between 2014 to 2017 .

documents.title: how much is scotland spending on research ?
text: according to the scottish government 's statistics on research and development in 2016 , business r & d increased by 10 % to £ 1.073bn , which was three times uk 's growth in 2015 .
but it remains low by international standard , as a share of gdp , says bbc 's scotland business and economy editor douglass fraser

documents.title: breakingconviviality confirms it failed to get funding
text: bargain booze owner conviviality has now confirmed that it was unable to raise £ 125m from investors to `` adequately recapitalise the business '' .

conviviality said : `` the company is in discussions with its lending banks and advisors regarding other possible options and is in receipt of a number of inbound enquiries regarding a potential sale of all or parts the business .
a further update will be made as appropriate .
`` the board believe that shareholders in the company will receive little-to-nil value . ''

documents.title: wall street on the move
text: wall street shares are now on the move , except for the nasdaq , which is still being dragged down by losses in amazon , intel and tesla .
the dow jones is now up 173.3 points or 0.73 % to 24,031.05 , led by verizon , up 2.2 % to $ 48.37 after analysts at hsbc upgraded the stocks to buy from hold .
the s & p 500 is also slightly higher , rising 8.8 points or 0.34 % to 2,621.38 .
pharmaceutical firm abbbvie is top of the winners , rising 4.8 % to $ 96.43 , despite being ordered to pay $ 3m following a lawsuit over whether its drug androgel caused heart attacks .
and finally the tech-heavy nasdaq is flat , slipping just 4.4 points or 0.06 % to 7,004.39 .

documents.title: london closes slightly ahead
text: london shares have closed slightly ahead , as british drugmaker the shire soared after japan 's takeda pharmaceutical co said it was considering a possible offer for the firm .
the ftse 100 ended up 44.6 points of 0.64 % to 7,044.74 .
the ftse 250 was slightly lower , down 32.5 points or 0.17 % to 19,356.59 .

documents.title: bargain booze in trouble ?
text: discount alcohol chain bargain booze is apparently heading into administration after failing to raise funds from an emergency cash call .
sky news reports that bargain booze owner conviviality is expected to announce later today that it has been unable to secure the funds , which means 2,500 jobs could be at risk .
a number of suppliers are understood to have deserted the company .
this comes two weeks after conviviality said it had discovered an unexpected £ 30m tax bill that had to be paid by the end of march .

documents.title: tom hayes loses appeal over sale of family home
text: tom hayes , a former trader at ubs and citigroup who was jailed for 11 years over the libor interest rate-rigging scandal , has lost an appeal against a confiscation order over the hayes ' family home .
hayes ' wife sarah tighe was forced to sell their £ 1.6m seven-bedroom family home the old rectory .
hayes had purchased the home by himself .

although he transferred his half of the proceeds to his wife , the court of appeal ruled that it is legitimate to use the house proceeds to pay off the £ 880,000 he was ordered to pay when he was convicted .
`` sarah has been forced to sell her own assets to pay my confiscation order in order to prevent me from being forced to serve an even longer prison sentence .
this is unfair on sarah and my 6-year-old son , joshua , '' hayes said .
`` the proceeds of crime act is punitive and draconian and can leave innocent children homeless . ''
ms tighe said she was disappointed that her contributions to their marriage had not been recognised .
she now plans to take the matter up with the equality and human rights commission .

documents.title: youtube 'prankster ' sued by in-n-out burger
text: a californian fast-food chain is suing a youtube videomaker over claims his `` prank '' films caused `` irreparable harm '' to two of its restaurants .
one incident allegedly involved cody roeder telling a customer their meal was `` contaminated '' and `` garbage '' while pretending to be the company 's chief executive .
in-n-out burger is seeking damages of more than $ 25,000 ( £ 17,660 ) .

documents.title: plastics deposit return scheme 'to raise price of bottles '
text: the price of bottles and cans of drinks would have to rise to help pay for the government 's proposed deposit return scheme , the plastics industry has warned .
the government wants a returnable deposit on single-use containers to help cut waste and boost recycling .
but the plastics industry said prices would also need to go up to help pay for the necessary infrastructure .
the government said the cost would have to be `` proportionate '' to any benefits .
read more here

documents.title: british airways decides to retain call centres
text: british airways has decided to retain its two call centres in manchester and new castle , concluding discussions with managed services firm capita , which had hoped to win a contract to run the operations .
instead , ba intends to keep the call centres in-house and invest several million pounds into them .
ba 's global customer contact operations handle about 9.5 million calls annually .

documents.title: children 's toy , or an expensive hobby ?
text: filling this year 's panini world cup sticker book costs £ 773.60 , twice the cost for euro 2016 , according to maths expert prof paul harper .
the pages contain 32 squads of players , plus managers , stadiums and world cup legends , totalling 682 stickers .
a pack of five stickers has risen from 50p to 80p - a 60 % increase .
if you buy 137 packets and never get the same sticker twice , it will cost £ 109.60 , but this is `` extremely unlikely '' , says the professor .

documents.title: tech shares drag down wall street
text: wall street shares have had a mixed open , as financial and technology stocks were pulled lower , while healthcare stocks saw gains .
the dow jones industrial average rose 26.7 points or 0.11 % to 23,884.44 , led by microsoft up 1.3 % to $ 90.66 and coca-cola rising 1.2 % to $ 43.41 .
despite this , intel slipped 2.9 % to $ 49.72 and jp morgan fell 1.94 % to $ 108.17 .
the s & p 500 fell 46 points or 1.7 % to 2,612.62 , with the losers led by cleveland-based bank keycorp , sliding 3.3 % to $ 19.27 , and investment firm franklin resources slipping 8.9 % to $ 34.28 .
the tech-heavy nasdaq also dropped 73.8 points or 1.09 % to 6,932.61 .
amazon shares fell 4.9 % to $ 1,424.17 , while apple slid 1.1 % to $ 166.53 , and tesla dropped 4.7 % to $ 265.97 .

documents.title: begors can be choosers
text: credit-monitoring firm equifax has named warburg pincus executive mark begor as chief executive .
mr begor will replace richard smith , who left equifax last september following mounting criticism over a huge data breach that plunged the company into crisis .

documents.title: now uber looks to india sale
text: after uber sold its southeast asia unit to rival grab earlier this week , reports now suggest that that talks have been held between ola and the us firm for a potential merger of their india units .
the business standard reports that while talks between uber and ola have been going on for the past twelve months or so , they have gathered intensity in the past few days .
the deal would mark uber 's fourth large global retreat .
the company sold its china unit to rival didi , its russian unit to local player yandex and on monday announced that it was selling its southeast asia unit to grab .

documents.title: which would you choose ?
text: canadian teenager charlie lagarde had an enviable decision to make - how best to cash in her lottery win .
she struck the jackpot after buying a scratch lottery ticket for the first time to mark her 18th birthday .
she had the choice between taking a c $ 1m ( us $ 780,000 ; £ 550,000 ) lump sum or receiving c $ 1,000 a week for life .
she chose the tax-free weekly payment .
was that wise ?
news asked two financial advisers for their opinion .
read their views here

documents.title: vehicle rental firm collapses with loss of 428 jobs
text: more than 400 workers are to lose their jobs after a vehicle hire firm in scotland collapsed .
tom vehicle rental , based in airdrie , north lanarkshire , called in administrators after it was unable to overcome `` operational difficulties '' .
ernst & young confirmed 342 employees had been made redundant across eleven locations in scotland and england .
administrators have retained 86 employees for up to four weeks to help them wind down the business .

documents.title: labour mp claims 'hedge fund scam ' surrounds gkn shares
text: during today 's prime minister 's question time , labour 's jack dromey said that a hedge fund scam is being used to avoid paying tax on shares that will determine the future of gkn in the hostile takeover bid by melrose .
he asked theresa may to investigate .
mrs may said that if mr dromey had evidence of illegal activities taking place , then that must be reported to the authorities .

documents.title: ftse regains ground
text: the ftse 100 has regained all the ground it lost this morning and is currently hovering just above last nights closing figure .
it 's up 2.16 points on the day , a rise of just 0.031 % .
the 250 index remains in negative territory .
it 's fallen 88.89 points today , a fall of 0.45 % , to 19,300.24 .
shire remains the biggest winner , up 17 % , on news of a takeover bid from japanese firm takeda .

documents.title: apple sales forecast slashed by goldman sachs
text: goldman sachs has slashed its apple iphone sales estimates by 1.7m units for the first six months of the year .
it said it now expects iphone sales of 53 million units in the march quarter and 40.3 million units in the three months to june .

in a note , the us investment bank 's analysts said : `` iphone demand expectations for march and june are already weak but we believe that early cq1 demand indications suggest even lower actual numbers , ''
it has cut its iphone shipment forecast by 2.5 % for apple 's fiscal year , which ends on 30 september 2018 .
it also cut expectations for fiscal 2019 and 2020 by 4 % and 1.8 % respectively .

documents.title: 300 jobs to go at coca-cola
text: coca-cola has confirmed it will close sites in milton keynes and northampton , with the loss of almost 300 jobs .
the fizzy drinks giant said the closures will take place in 2019 .
a coca-cola european partners spokesman said : `` while this was a difficult decision to make , we believe it is the right way forward for our business . ''
read more here .

documents.title: colmans to close norwich factory
text: colman 's will close its norwich factory by 2019 , putting 113 jobs at risk .

jon strachan , vice president supply chain unilever uk & ireland , which owns the brand , said the closure `` follows britvic 's decision last year that it will close its factory on our shared site '' .
unilever said the manufacturing of the vast majority of products will move to a factory in burton upon trent .
however , unilever said it will maintain links to norwich where the mustard has been made since 1814 .

`` we intend to retain the production and packing of colman 's mustard powder , the historic mustard milling process and mint processing in a new state-of-the-art milling facility in the norwich area , created through a new long-term partnership with a consortium of local growers , backed by significant investment from unilever . ''
around 40 roles will transfer to burton and the new milling facility near norwich will create some 25 jobs .

documents.title: facebook admits it 's 'lost people 's trust'the bbc 's technology correspondent tweets
text: facebook revamps privacy settings - insists this planned long before current controversy but spokesman tells me : `` facebook recognises it 's clearly lost people 's trust and it needs to get to work on regaining that . ''
these controls were easy enough to find already , but i do n't think many users bothered previously .
maybe now they 'll pay more attention .

documents.title: facebook revamps its privacy controls
text: facebook says an overhaul of its privacy tools will make it easier for people to find and edit the personal information the company holds .
details of the changes were announced in a blog .
they follow intense criticism of the firm after it emerged that data about 50 million users had been harvested and passed on to a political consultancy .
however , facebook says the revamp was already planned ahead of the scandal in order to comply with new eu rules .
read the full story here .

documents.title: breakinggoogle 's tax bill rises to £ 50m
text: google will pay nearly £ 50m in tax to the treasury this year .
the technology giant 's annual accounts show that the company will pay corporation taxes of £ 49.3m on uk profits of £ 202.4m .
although the tax figure is the highest the company has paid - and up on the £ 36.4m it paid last year - it will be likely to reignite the debate about taxation and digital firms .
the total value of google 's sales in the uk is about £ 5.7bn a year .
read kamal 's blog here .
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

documents.title: no big bounce for retailers
text: more on that difficult march for retailers .
in its survey , the cbi said sales for the time of year were significantly below normal , and by the greatest extent since april 2013 .
it said there was a fall in trade at department stores across areas such as furniture and carpets as well as clothing .
looking ahead , retailers said they expect sales volumes and orders placed with suppliers to grow `` though at a fairly subdued pace '' .

documents.title: anbang boss goes on trial in china
text: the former chairman of chinese insurance and financial giant anbang has gone on trial in shanghai .
wu xiaohui , who was detained last year , denies alleged economic crimes , including fundraising fraud and embezzlement .
in february the chinese government made an unusual move , ordering anbang to be taken over by the country 's insurance regulator for one year .
anbang is known for its aggressive international acquisitions , including new york 's waldorf astoria hotel .
chinese authorities have been cracking down on the financial industry to guard against excessive borrowing and risk .
the anbang move has prompted questions over who might be next .

documents.title: shire would strengthen oncology , says takeda
text: commenting on a possible bid for shire pharmaceuticals , takeda said it `` continuously considers various options aiming to accelerate its growth , focusing on prioritized therapeutic areas of gastroenterology , oncology and neuroscience plus vaccines '' .
it said a takeover would help the business expand in the us .

it also said it would `` accelerate takeda 's vision to be a leader in specialized medicines that are transformative to patients through the addition of shire 's leading global rare disease franchise '' .

documents.title: shire shares surge on possible takeover
text: shares in shire pharmaceuticals have jumped 18 % to £ 36.24 after japan 's takeda said it is considering making an approach for the dublin-based business .
takeda said an offer is at a `` preliminary and exploratory stage '' and it has not approached shire 's board .

documents.title: snow hampers retail sales
text: retail sales fell for the first time in five months in march because of heavy snow fall coupled with the financial strains on households , according to a survey by the confederation of british industry .
the cbi distributive trades survey 's retail sales balance fell to -8 from +8 in february .
cbi economist ben jones said : `` against a backdrop of stagnating household incomes and weak consumer confidence , the lengthy cold snap earlier this month has heaped added pressure on retailers .
`` freezing conditions and transport disruption caused people to avoid the high street .
with many forced to work from home , telecoms firms saw record internet traffic , yet on-line shopping slowed sharply given the potential for disrupted deliveries . ''

documents.title: bestway says profits rose 8.5 %
text: cash-and-carry-to-cement conglomerate bestway said pre-tax profits rose 8.5 % to £ 448.4m in the year to 30 june 2017 .

the company , which employs 4,500 workers in the uk including at the well pharmacy chain , said it benefited from the brexit-devalued pound while improving performance in its wholesale and cement businesses .
but it warned that `` market conditions in the wholesale sector remain challenging '' , and reported that wholesale revenues fell 2 % to £ 2.13bn .
the company is pakistan 's largest cement manufacturer and also owner of ubl , the country 's second-largest private bank .
it said : `` business conditions in pakistan have remained stable during the year . ''

documents.title: council tax to rise 5.1 %
text: the average band d council tax in england for 2018-19 will climb 5.1 % to £ 1,671 , the government has announced .
average council tax bills in shire areas are the highest at £ 1,749 , up by £ 86 , according to the ministry of housing , communities & local government .
its figures showed the average band d household in london will pay £ 1,405 , an increase of £ 55 on 2017/18 .

documents.title: lv= profits motor up to £ 122m
text: insurer lv= said it made £ 122m last year , compared to a £ 49m loss the previous year .
however the firm was hit by the cut in the ogden rate in 2016 , without which pre-tax profits would have been £ 113m , it said .
richard rowney , lv= group chief executive , said : 2017 has been a transformative year for lv= . ''
the mutual sold 49 % of its general insurance business to allianz during the year for £ 500m .

documents.title: malaysia fraud suspect : get your hands off my yacht
text: the malaysian financier accused of coming up with a scheme to siphon $ 4.5bn ( £ 3.2bn ) from a government fund is objecting to us authorities seizing his superyacht .
and the reason : he reckons they wo n't be able to look after it .
prosecutors are trying to recover assets they claim jho low bought with money stolen from 1malaysia development bhd - better known a 1mdb .
that includes the $ 250m cruiser called equanimity - currently moored off the indonesian island of bali .
but accoridng to mr low 's lawyers , this is a bad idea .
the government does not know how to properly maintain or market a luxury yacht as unique and distinctive as ( this ) , '' they wrote in a letter filed by the us justice department .

specific worries include the us wanting to trim the number of staff from 20 to eight - which the letter claims is `` a number so low that it would endanger the lives of the crew on board and wreak havoc on the condition of the yacht '' .
selling the 300ft-vessel in us would generate a lower price as the market is `` enemic '' , the lawyers say - something that officials deny .

documents.title: ofcom caps bt 's broadband charges
text: telecoms regulator ofcom is cutting the price bt can charge rivals to use its fast broadband service .
it will also make it easier for providers to use bt 's infrastructure to build their own networks to boost the roll-out of fibre .

ofcom said : `` bt must make its telegraph poles and underground tunnels open to rival providers , making it quicker and easier for them to build their own full-fibre networks directly to households around the uk . ''
the regulator said it would cap the amount bt 's openreach network can charge rivals to use its entry-level superfast broadband service .

documents.title: air china shares fall despite best profits since 2011
text: air china saw its shares fall 3 % on wednesday after its annual profits missed forecasts - despite being the best for six years .
a buoyant cargo market and strengthening yuan helped profits rise 6.3 % in 2017 from a year earlier to 7.2bn yuan ( £ 810m ; $ 1.2bn ) .
but higher-than-predicted fuel and leasing costs meant this was less than analysts had been expecting .
china 's airlines are getting a fillip from a desire among the country 's middle class to travel more both domestically and abroad .

documents.title: ftse indexes fall
text: the ftse 100 is trading down 44.72 points , or 0.64 % , at 6,955.42 .
pharmaceutical giant shire is leading the risers with its share price up 3.91 % at £ 31.90 .
the ftse 250 is off 142.49 points or 0.73 % at 19,246.64 .
shares in dfs furniture have jumped 7.76 % to 183.20p after it gave an upbeat outlook on trading .
meanwhile , aviva 's share price has ticked 8 points lower to 494.20p after the fca said it would examine the insurer 's controversial proposal - now shelved - to buy back preference shares .

documents.title: skybet 'embarassed ' by problem gambler failure
text: richard flint , chief executive of sky betting and gaming which owns the skybet brand , told radio 5 live breakfast that the company 's failure to stop problem gamblers betting again `` is embarrassing '' .
he said : `` it 's not good enough .
we could and should have done more .
it should n't have happened . ''
he admitted that the company `` did n't make it sufficiently difficult for people to open up duplicate accounts . ''
mr flint said the firm now runs check to see if there are duplicate accounts and has a team monitoring accounts daily to look for unusual behaviour .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: we needed to do more , says skybet
text: richard flint , chief executive of sky betting & gaming , which owns the skybet brand , says : `` we have always taken responsible gambling and player protection very seriously but this incident showed that we needed to do more .
when we spotted the issue we pro-actively notified the gambling commission and have worked to improve our processes to avoid this happening again . ''
he said : `` we could and should have made it harder for self-excluded customers to open duplicate accounts with us and for that we are sorry .
`` we fully agree with the gambling commission 's findings and will donate the agreed sum to charities for socially responsible purposes . ''

documents.title: 'serious failure ' by skybet
text: commenting on the decision to hand skybet the penalty , the gambling commission 's programme director richard watson , said : `` this was a serious failure affecting thousands of potentially vulnerable customers and the £ 1m penalty package should serve as a warning to all gambling businesses .
protecting consumers from gambling-related harm is a priority for us and where we see operators failing in their responsibility to keep their customers safe we will take tough action .
skybet reported the issues to us quickly , cooperated with us and has taken this investigation seriously . ''

documents.title: skybet weaknesses allowed problem gamblers to continue
text: the gambling commission says that because of weaknesses in skybet 's self-exclusion facilities :

documents.title: breakingskybet fined £ 1m for failing to protect vulnerable customers
text: the gambling commission has fined skybet £ 1m for failing to protect vulnerable consumers .
it said the failures relate to skybet customers who had self-excluded from gambling .
`` self-exclusion is a tool used by consumers who feel they are having trouble controlling their gambling and request that the operator refuse their service . ''

documents.title: watch : nestle to 'restructure ' sugar in milkybars
text: nestle is claiming a world first by `` restructuring '' the sugar it uses in its confectionery .
it has produced a white chocolate bar with 30 % less sugar than its usual milkybar brand .
the government wants manufacturers to cut the amount of sugar in snacks by 20 % by 2020 .

documents.title: london stock markets open lower
text: the ftse 100 fell 48.32 points to 6,951.82 in early trading .
the ftse 250 is off 67.13 points at 19,322.00 .

documents.title: dfs will 'ride out the storm '
text: sales are down at dfs but `` this is a case of battening down the hatches and riding out the storm , '' reckons neil wilson , senior market analyst at etx capital .
he says : `` dfs is managing to handle the broader downturn in retail pretty well .

the collapse of feather & black , warren evans and multiyork , whose assets dfs has acquired , served to indicate the severe pressure on the market and the opportunity for those with enough scale to see it out .
`` dfs has form here and looks to have turned a corner , '' he said .
while rivals fail , the scale and flexibility of dfs is insulating it from the worst of the troubles facing the market . ''

documents.title: asia stocks follow us lower
text: stocks in asia were lower on wednesday following wall street as investors lost confidence in the information and technology sector .
concerns around tighter government controls for companies like facebook , which is amid a private data-usage outcry , saw shares in hong kong-listed tencent down nearly 4 % in afternoon trade .
hong kong 's hang seng index was down 1.8 % in afternoon trade .
japan 's benchmark nikkei 225 was hurt by the auto industry , losing 1.3 % during the session , to close at 20,031.31 points .
toyota shares fell 3 % while nissan dropped 3.2 % .

documents.title: the heart of the matter
text: the problem at aviva that is being examined by the fca surrounds a proposal by the insurer to cancel millions of pounds worth of preference shares to reduce debt .
aviva has since rowed back on the decision after receiving `` strong feedback and criticism '' .
a preference share entitles the owner to a fixed dividend or payment from the company in question .
that payment takes priority over ordinary share dividends .
shareholders had understood that these shares could not be cancelled .

in a letter to the treasury select committee , the fca said : `` our immediate concern had been to understand the basis upon which aviva was acting , including the clarity of the information available to securities holders along with the market integrity concerns that the proposals raised . ''

it said : `` in particular , we are focusing on the treatment of those holders ( and potentially now former holders ) of the company 's irredeemable preference shares that may have lost out financially as a result of these events . ''

documents.title: why are people moving home less ?
text: people are moving home half as often as they did before the credit crunch .
lucian cook , head of residential research at estate agent savills , tells the bbc 's today programme that it 's not just because of an aging population staying in homes longer and high stamp duty .
he says : `` it 's the interaction between mortgage regulation and the housing market . ''
he reckons regulation `` is restricting how much people can borrow and how much equity they need to trade up the housing ladder . ''
meanwhile where prices have n't climbed much , such as in the north , homeowners have n't accumulated enough equity to get a mortgage to trade up .
in london , however , homeowners have plenty of equity but have n't got enough income to borrow enough to move , he says .

BBC Radio 4

documents.title: breakingwatchdog investigates aviva over preference shares proposal
text: aviva , the insurance group , is being reviewed by the financial conduct authority following a a controversial move to cancel £ 450m worth of preference shares .

documents.title: time out moves from listings to transactions
text: time out group has reported widening annual pre-tax losses of £ 14.2m compared to a previous £ 10.5m despite a 19 % rise in sales to £ 44.3m .
chief executive julio bruno said the company is going through changes and is no longer a listings publisher .
he said : we are successfully evolving time out into a transactional business .
millions of customers now book theatre tickets , attractions and hotels with us , buy exclusive offers and experience one of our live events worldwide and time out market . ''
it also announced that it has signed a lease on a building in new york to house a new time out market .

documents.title: saga finance chief moves to paddy power betfair
text: saga chief financial officer jonathan hill will make the switch to paddy power betfair in the autumn .
he will replace alex gersh , who announced his intention to leave last month .
hill joined saga three years ago and was previously at bovis homes , tui travel and centrica .

documents.title: dfs upbeat despite profit fall
text: while other retailers are struggling , furniture specialist dfs is feeling upbeat despite a fall in interim profits .
pre-tax income for the six months to 27 january fell to £ 11.6m from £ 16.7m on sales up 4.3 % £ 396.1m .
however , not including the acquisition of sofology , pre-tax profits fell even further , down 58.1 % to £ 7m .
chief executive ian filby says dfs as seen `` strengthening trading momentum '' since july 2017 which has continued into the first three months of this year .
he says the company will deliver `` modest growth '' in underlying profit and strong cash generation for the financial year .

documents.title: people 'are willing ' to travel in self-driving cars
text: john krafcik , chief executive of waymo , tells the bbc 's today programme that `` a lot of people '' will be willing to jump into a car with no-one behind the wheel .
he says : `` our experience so far in phoenix , if it 's any indication , is that a lot of people will [ be willing ] .
more people than we would be able to handle , to be honest . ''
the company has just launched a self-driving car with jaguar .

documents.title: drinks bottles and can deposit return scheme proposed
text: people in england will soon have to pay a deposit when they buy drinks bottles and cans in a bid to boost recycling and cut waste .
the deposit will increase prices - but consumers will get the money back if they return the container .
the scheme is expected to cover single-use glass and plastic bottles , and steel and aluminium cans .
full details are subject to consultation and yet to be decided , including how big the deposit will be .
read more here .
author: Roger Harrabin
BBC environment analyst

documents.title: uber will not renew californian self-driving permit
text: while jaguar and waymo are excitedly unveiling their new premium autonomous car , uber is still dealing with aftermath of a fatal collision involving a self-driving vehicle .

overnight , uber said it will not renew its permit to test self-driving cars in california until police and regulators finish their investigation into the crash that killed a woman in tempe , arizona .

documents.title: nationwide plans business banking move
text: nationwide building society says it plans to move into business banking for the first time in its 172-year history , but only if it 's successful in winning a grant from rbs .
it is part of rbs ' £ 833m commitment to encourage small and medium-sized businesses to move to other banks .
nationwide boss joe garner tells the bbc 's today programme : `` we 've looked at it many times in the past but the price of entry into business banking has always been too high for us . ''
but he was quick to reassure existing customers that the nationwide `` will not be taking more risk or moving up the risk curve '' .
if they get the rbs cash , the mutual will concentrate on small businesses that need banking services , not loans , he says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: oscillating wildly
text: shares in asia are trading lower in what has been a very choppy market in general for global stocks .
chris ralph , chief investment officer at st james 's place , tells wake up to money : `` it 's interesting because we talked of 2017 as being a year with low volatility .
as we go into 2018 , there 's more volatility .
tech shares in the us saw their worst one day fall yesterday .

twitter was down 12 % , facebook was down another 5 % and tesla was down 8 % so yes , we are seeing volatility and actually considering what the underlying news is coming out from those companies , i do n't think that 's surprising . ''

documents.title: m & s in tight spot for ftse reshuffle
text: today , the ftse 100 will lose ladbrokes coral from its ranks when it delists on wednesday following the takeover by gvc holdings .
with gkn facing a hostile bid by melrose , who could be promoted - or demoted - from london 's blue chip index ?
chris ralph , chief investment officer at st james 's place , has been looking at the companies who could move in and out of the ftse 100 .
`` the venerable old marks & spencer sits below the 90th largest company in the uk which i must admit surprised me , '' he tells wake up to money .
he also points out that melrose could move up from the ftse 250 into the leading index .

documents.title: nothing to be proud of
text: john krafcik , the chief executive of waymo , which has just launched a new self-driving car with jaguar , reckons there are real problems with safety on the roads .
he says : `` what is happening on the roads is nothing that we humans should be proud of - 1.25 million people die every year on roads around the world .
`` it 's like a 737 crashing every hour of every day . ''
he says : `` i do n't think we should be happy with that .
i think we as a world should say 'that 's not good enough ' . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: is now the right time for a new self-driving car ?
text: jaguar and waymo , the autonomous driving division of google , unveiled their `` premium '' self-driving car in new york overnight .
jaguar wants to test the car on public roads later this year and plans to have 20,000 vehicles ready to be self-driving taxis by 2020 .
however , following a fatal collision involving a self-driving uber car , is now the right time for this ?
waymo 's chief executive john krafcik says : `` our focus has always been on safety .
its how we founded this project more than nine years ago at google as the self-driving car project .
during that time we 've driven almost 5 million miles autonomously on public roads in the us , testing in 25 different cities . ''
but does he expect the situation at uber to have an impact of the appetite for self-driving cars ?
`` we 'll have to see , '' he says .
`` our job is just to get out there and be as transparent as we possibly can with our technology . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live
